greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = max { k | A064553(k) = n }.
comment: In the plot, the lowest line corresponds to the cases when a(n)=prime(n-1). - _T. D. Noe_, Dec 12 2004
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8000
mathematica: (* b = A064553 *) nmax = 67; b[1] = 1; b[p_?PrimeQ] := b[p] = PrimePi[p] + 1; b[n_] := b[n] = b[p = FactorInteger[n][[1, 1]]]*b[n/p]; bb = Table[{k, b[k]}, {k, 1, 4*Prime[nmax]}]; A064555 = Max[#[[All, 1]]]& /@ Split[ Sort[bb, #1[[2]] < #2[[2]] &], #1[[2]] == #2[[2]]&]; a[n_] := A064555[[n]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, nmax}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 04 2012 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 21 2001
